Title: Indian-American takes oath as Ambassador-at-Large for Global Women's Issues
Content:
Indian-American Geeta Rao Gupta has been sworn-in as the Ambassador-at-Large for the Office of Global Women's Issues in the US State Department, becoming the first woman of colour to hold the position.

Gupta, who was administered the oath of office by vice president Kamala Harris on July 10, was confirmed by 51 to 47 votes in the Senate for the position in May. While announcing her appointment in May, the State Department had said it тАЬlooks forward to her efforts to promote women and girls' rights through US foreign policy.тАЭ

"The inequality has increased", said Gupta

During her confirmation hearing last year before the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations, Gupta had said she was a proud US citizen and a first-generation immigrant, belonging to a family of professional women, each of whom dedicated their lives to serving their communities. тАЬIf you look at the world today, the situation of women, if you look at the gender inequality indicators, they show that the inequality has increased,тАЭ she had said.

According to Gupta, women are unable to participate fully in the economy as there are many inequalities and indignities holding them back. Mumbai-born Gupta previously served as senior fellow at the United Nations Foundation and senior advisor to Co-impact, a global collaborative philanthropy for systems change. While at the UN Foundation, Gupta founded and served as the executive director and later as senior advisor of the 3D Program for Girls and Women. With over decades of experience on gender and development, Gupta has also served on an oversight committee for the World Health Organisation's Health Emergencies Programme, and co-chaired the World Bank's Global Gender-based Violence Task Force.

Gupta has been awarded "Women Who Mean Business" award

She was the deputy executive director, Programmes at UNICEF, and prior to that as a senior fellow at the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. She is the recipient of numerous awards, including InterActionтАЩs Julia Taft Award for Outstanding Leadership, Harvard University's Anne Roe Award and Washington Business Journal's "Women Who Mean Business" Award. She is armed with a Phd in Psychology from Bangalore University and an M.Phil and M.A. from the University of Delhi.

(Source: IANS)

Title: IPLтАЩs business enterprise value tops $15 billion
Content:
IPL (image: IANS)

Houlihan Lokey, Inc., the global investment bank, today issued the Indian Premier League (IPL) brand valuation Study 2023, its inaugural report into the business enterprise and brand values of the IPL.

With a brand value of $212m (тВ╣1747.3cr), growing year-on-year at 45.2 per cent, Chennai Super Kings (CSK) is ranked first in both brand ranking and business enterprise value ranking. Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) ranks second in terms of brand value at $195m (тВ╣1607.4cr).

Rajasthan Royals (RR) saw the highest incremental brand value rise in percentage terms year-on-year of 103 per cent.

According to the report, the stand-alone brand value of the IPL is now $3.2bn (тВ╣26,377.9cr), up by 80 per cent from $1.8bn (тВ╣14,836.9cr) in 2022.

The business enterprise value of the IPL stands at $15.4bn (тВ╣1,26,940.9cr), up 80 per cent from $8.5bn (тВ╣70,069cr) in 2022, mainly due to the impact of the 2023 -2027 media rights deal with Viacom18 and Disney Star after a fiercely contested auction.

The IPLтАЩs media rights have grown at a phenomenal (Compound Annual Growth Rate) CAGR of 18 per cent from 2008 to 2023, while the growth in absolute terms between the 2017 and 2023 cycles is 196 per cent.

IPL now a prominent global spectacle

When the IPLтАЩs broadcasting fee is compared with other professional leagues in the world on a per-match basis, the IPL fares well above the likes of the National Basketball Association (NBA), the English Premier League (EPL) and the Bundesliga (first tier German football league) and is second only to the National Football League (NFL).

тАЬCreated on the American style of franchise-based systems of hiring players, the IPL has established itself as a hugely lucrative sports league, along similar lines as the NFL and the NBA,тАЭ commented Harsh Talikoti, senior vice president, corporate valuation advisory services at Houlihan Lokey.

(Source: IANS)

Title: Gujarat batsman Priyank Panchal named as the captain for West Zone in Deodhar Trophy
Content:
Gujarat's opening batsman Priyank Panchal has also been selected as the captain of the West Zone in the Duleep Trophy and Deodhar Trophy one-day tournament.

A total of eight players from Gujarat, Saurashtra, and Baroda have been included in the West Zone team of the Deodhar Trophy. The tournament will start on July 24.

Shivam Dube makes it to the team

Chennai Super Kings' Shivam Dube, who has made a remarkable appearance in the IPL, has also been included in the West Zone squad. Dube scored a total of 418 runs in 16 IPL matches.

Players from Gujarat, Saurashtra, and Baroda

Along with Priyank Panchal, GujaratтАЩs wicketkeeper-batsman Het Patel and fast bowlers Chintan Gaja and Azan Nagwaswala have also been named in the Deodhar Trophy West Zone team. Saurashtra's Harvik Desai, Samarth Vyas and Parth Bhut, and Baroda's fast bowling all-rounder Atit Seth were also included in the team.

Chetan Sakariya, Yuvrajsinh Dodiya, Kathan Patel, A Kazi, and Tushar Deshpande have been selected as the standbys.

Title: Foxconn withdraws from JV with Vedanta for chip manufacture
Content:
Foxconn-Vedanta; Semiconductor (image: Envato Elements)

In a major setback to prime minister Narendra Modi's plans of making India a chip-manufacturing hub, Taiwanese chip-making giant Foxconn today announced that it has withdrawn from a joint venture with India-based industrial giant Vedanta.

Foxconn was supposed to execute a $19.5 billion semiconductor joint venture with metals to oil conglomerate Vedanta.

Foxconn and Vedanta had signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) in 2022 to establish semiconductor and display production parts in Gujarat, the home state of PM Modi.

тАЬFoxconn has determined it will not move forward on the joint venture (JV) with Vedanta,тАЭ the company said in a statement, without elaborating over the matter.

It maintained that the withdrawal matter is settled between the two companies.

However, Vedanta said it will go ahead with the project.

тАЬVedanta reiterates that it is fully committed to its semiconductor fab project and we have lined up other partners to set up IndiaтАЩs first foundry. We will continue to grow our Semiconductor team, and we have the license for production-grade technology for 40 nm from a prominent Integrated Device Manufacturer (IDM).тАЭ 

тАЬWe will shortly acquire a license for production-grade 28 nm as well. Vedanta has redoubled its efforts to fulfill the prime ministerтАЩs vision for semiconductors and India remains pivotal in repositioning global semiconductor supply chains,тАЭ a company spokesperson said.

(Source: IANS)
